topic.title: Why are a majority of the ZeroNet users Chinese?
topic.body: Just out of sheer curiosity why are most users Chinese. Is it simply just popular over there, or is it something else entirely?

topic.title: How aware is the Chinese government about Zero NET?
topic.body: I'm doubtful that anyone really has an answer to this, but I am curious about how aware the Chinese government is about the existence of Zero NET and are they trying to take action against it.

1522391642_1Jt6aamh4UWpSRG421JivqanL5SQc.body: Yeah that is what I thought...

1523082496_14UupgrdnT7Y8vMES7aqUFgD1fC5R.body: I personally like the idea but have never tried it myself...

1522450733_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rY.body: I personally believe for privacy alone it is absolutely worth it.

1525203779_1KCJ86Jg3LNBpHxcaRojsHTg9Qme9.body:
Just played the game and can confirm it's a Unity asset called Unit Z:
https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/templates/unitz-26912 

The game was sort of infamous due to the fact a lot of "indie devs" were uploading it to the steam store with little to no changes to it and passing it off as their own game.
